Instance.description: An aspiration that doesn't need any data to display to the UI.

Tunable.name: can_complete_without_objectives
Tunable.description: If checked, this Milestone can have 0 objectives and be completed. If unchecked, having zero objectives won't complete this Milestone. This can be used for Milestones like Missions that have dynamically- added Objectives that might not be available when the Milestone is tested for completion.

Tunable.name: do_not_register_events_on_load
Tunable.display: Do Not Register Events On Load
Tunable.description: If checked we will not register these events on load. This should be checked for all aspirations that are part of an aspiration track.

TunableVariant.name: objective_completion_type
TunableVariant.description: A requirement of what objectives need to be completed.

TunableTuple.name: complete_all
TunableTuple.description: All of the Objectives as part of this Milestone must be completed in order for this Milestone to be considered complete.

TunableTuple.name: complete_subset
TunableTuple.description: A numerical subset of the total Objectives need to be complete for this Milestone to be considered complete.

Tunable.name: number_required
Tunable.description: The number of objectives as part of this Milestone that must be completed until this Milestone is considered complete.

TunableList.name: objectives
TunableList.description: A list of all of the Objectives that will be tracked in order for this Milestone to be completed. Using the Objective Completion Type we will determine the action number of Objectives that need to be completed.

Tunable.description: An Objective that is one of the requirements for this Milestone to be completed.

TunableVariant.name: screen_slam
TunableVariant.description: Which screen slam to show when this aspiration is complete. Localization Tokens: Sim - {0.SimFirstName}, Milestone Name - {1.String}, Aspiration Track Name - {2.String}. Works with Full Aspirations and Career Aspirations only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a ScreenSlam tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If true, the screen slam will be only be shown if the active Sim triggers it.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: A sting to play at the same time as the screen slam. ***Some screen slams may appear to play a sting, but the audio is actually tuned on something else. Example: On CareerLevel tuning there already is a tunable, Promotion Audio Sting, to trigger a sting, so one is not necessary on the screen slam. Make sure to avoid having multiple stings play simultaneously.***

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.
